metadata.titel_preek: Holy Intrigue, Runt, and the Spirit

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God disrupts the established political and social order (Saul/Jesse's hierarchy) to establish a new kingdom through a 'nobody' (David), demonstrating divine providence and sovereignty.

tekstueel_bewijs: God authorized Samuel to do a 'dirty trick'
God even gives him the right lines

object.identificatie: The Anointed King / New Historical Possibility
tekstueel_bewijs: to anoint David as the new king
God’s resolve is worked through the nobodies

ontvanger.identificatie: Israel / The Church / The 'Runts' of history
tekstueel_bewijs: designate him to govern over God’s people
to bring good news to the poor
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: Does hearer identify with Subject or Receiver?

tekstueel_bewijs: Samuel is a vehicle for holy intrigue
The spirit of the LORD came mightily upon David
helper.rol_van_god: God is both Subject (initiator) and Helper (Spirit).

tekstueel_bewijs: Saul hears of it, he will kill me
old hierarchies of power and wealth
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just a person, but a 'way of seeing' and a 'system of power' that rejects God's chosen.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The hearer's response: living 'carefully' and giving thanks in light of God's intrigue.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer (The 'We')
secundair_narratief_programma.object: A life of gratitude and attentiveness
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The ethical 'taking care' is framed as a response to the primary action of God's 'holy intrigue'.

voorbeelden_god_subject: God even gives him the right lines
voorbeelden_mens_subject: Samuel knew it was a hazardous journey
We might in Lent take notice
Be careful, then, how you live

voorbeelden: Be careful, then, how you live
Samuel is impatient and wants to get on with it
I will show you what you shall do
the LORD looks on the heart
when we are attentive we notice
The power of God creates historical possibilities
The spirit of the LORD came mightily

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon emphasizes God's 'Pouvoir' (Power/Ability) to act where humans cannot, shifting the focus from human 'Devoir' to divine enablement.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (Saul's power) to ~S2 (David the runt) to S1 (Spirit's power).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: God resolves the tension by choosing the 'not-S2' to manifest 'S1'.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; the threat of Saul and the blindness of Jesse are presented as real barriers.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While the sermon starts with an ethical imperative (Be careful), it quickly grounds all human action in the prior and superior 'Holy Intrigue' of God. God is the primary actor.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: It is not about how we think... It is about how we live.

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as the Subject of transformation
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: The power of God creates historical possibilities where none existed.
Samuel could not resist God’s relentless intent.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: David is not an example of virtue to follow, but an example of a 'nobody' whom God chooses.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides a theocentric reading: David is the object of God's choice, not the subject of his own success.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief from the burden of self-management; awe at God's 'intrigue'.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic undertones; God initiates, man responds with Eucharist.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The ethical frame (Paul) is well-integrated as a response to the narrative core (David).
spanning_punten: The tension between 'being careful' (human effort) and 'holy intrigue' (divine control).

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: God’s resolve pushes our lives... to reduce to nothing things that are.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit provides the 'Pouvoir-faire' that David lacked as a 'runt'.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is seen as the 'blindness' to God's work and the 'pride' of self-management.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains God as the Subject. The 'Holy Intrigue' acts as the engine of the narrative.

identificatie_herstel.strategie: Maintain the focus on being 'occupied by the Spirit'.

modale_balans.huidige_onbalans: Slightly heavy on Savoir (knowing God's intrigue).
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: More emphasis on how the Spirit enables the 'careful living' mentioned at the start.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: Saul is a good opponent, but 'human standards' could be more sharply defined.
tegenstander_intensivering.voorgestelde_intensivering: Describe the 'death' that Saul represents more vividly.
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: To make the 'new life' of David even more miraculous.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterful example of theocentric preaching that uses narrative structure to subvert moralism.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'runt' metaphor; semiotics focuses on the 'Subject' role of God.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains 1 Sam 16; semiotics explains how the sermon's 'engine' produces grace.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that 'Holy Intrigue' is not just a theme, but the 'Sender' that validates the entire narrative.

volledige_subject_lijst: Samuel (knew, says, did, arrived, reviewed, took)
The Spirit (came mightily, is upon me)
We (deceive, think, might take notice, give thanks)
volledige_object_lijst: A life other than the one we thought
appendices.notities: The sermon effectively uses the 'runt' as a signifier for the 'Receiver' actant.
